content.description: Bouldery start from left (low crux), then up the arete.

It might be called One and A Half Pines soon. A natural warm up climb. Low angle slabs to a crux at the end. This held water the longest of any climbs in the Electric Co. area when we were there (a couple of days after rain), requiring some different moves than if dry.
content.protection: Six bolts to an anchor, mostly of recent vintage.
content.location: This route involves the only two evergreens in the area, tiny pine trees of some sort.

content.description: Trad or solo the crack just left of Safe Harbor Direct. It's a nice cruiser that has fairly good gear.

A somewhat overlooked albeit very good route.  The climbing features some cool sidepull and thin face moves on vertical rock.  Work a bit right at bolt 2 and then crank back up and left to a steep rest and clip (crux 1).  Shake and then work back a bit right (crux 2) and up passing one more bolt to the shuts.
content.location: Scramble up a short, steep path to a ledge left of the main slab where SH Direct, Two Pines, etc. are located.  Sugar High is the route on the left.

content.description: Similar to its slabby neighbors, but SHD requires more thinking and delicate balance for some moves. A pleasure to climb.
content.protection: 6 bolts to anchors, hardware in good condition.
content.location:
Easy to find since "WPS" is spraypainted at the bottom.

 Graffiti has been overpainted with brown but the paint is still a usefull landmark.

content.description: Straightforward warm-up route. A few slabby moves exist if you're interested in eliminates.
Start same as Birch. Move up inside corner and then right to birch tree. Climb up Steeper terrain along a corner to a pancake flake at the top.
Easy big edge slab climbing up to the last bolt, crux seemed to be going from the last bolt to the anchors.
content.location: Bolt line to the right of the "WPS" spraypainted on the rock.

content.description: Fun route on occasionally slimy footholds
content.location: Farthest bolted route to the right

content.description: climb up face to 2nd bolt, then diagonal right up slab. Tricky feet at 3rd bolt

Climb arete starting below arete 10' right of Mia. Climb arete to Mia anchor. Many eliminates exist with a wide range of difficulties. The easiest starts in the hand crack to the right in corner and climbs left over the corner at second bolt(10d~11a).
3 bolts up steep slabby face to a shared 2 bolt anchor.  Crux is reaching a 2 finger pocket above the first bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
The middle route on the slabby face to the right of Electric Co.  

 Note - The Safe Harbor Mini-Guide refers to route 7, on the left of the slab as "Lost Boys", but I have it written in my guide from years ago that this is incorrect, that Lost boys is route 6 up the middle of the slab, and "Jump Start" is route 7 on the left.  Here on MP, the route is called "Black V" instead of Jump Start.

 I'm open to correcting this if someone really knows what is what here.

content.description: Start below and right of the first bolt Two Pines. Climb up to a pod (1-2" cam. Run it out up and right to left facing corner right of Two Pines (sling a birch tree move up left facing corner to a small pine and move left to Two Pine Anchors.
The steepest route on this wall, directly up the middle of the featured vertical face.
content.location: Coming from the south, this is the second wall.

content.description: Climb face straight up passing bolts. Follow new bolts over the top to new anchors.
content.location: Just right of "Sugar High". See description of Sugar High for Approach.

content.description: Fun slab climbing. Hands get thinner at last 2 bolts. 8+ variation starts 10 feet right.
content.location: starts 20 feet left of Safe Harbor Direct

content.description: Start on a tiny ramp below and right of the first bolt. Climb up ramp to triangle pinch. Step left, to good holds. Move up clipping next 2 bolts passing them on the left. At overhang hand jam traverse right and up to Lost Boys Anchors
Start in wide inside corner right of Snake. Climb the inside corner slinging birch trees and occasional gear in cracks. Just before the top go left to Snake anchors or continue to top and tree anchor
Start at crack 10' left of "Safe harbor Direct".   Climb up diagonally left to bolt. Next climb up to fourth bolt on "Can't remember". From here traverse left to "clever retort" anchor
Climbs around the steep route Electric Co. (5.10b) in Safe Harbor South. It consists of a cluster of vertical routes, with taller slabs to the left, and shorter slabs to the right.
